"And why it doesnâ€™t bother meâ€¦ 

1. I post when I have the capacity to do so. I know â€œpost daily!â€, but that sounds draining. I post whenever I can, and I have faith that the people who matter will stick around!

2. I remove all bot followers from my account. Anytime I see it, I delete! Iâ€™d rather have genuine humans who I can chat with.

3. I connect in DMs and my Discord more than I post. It began as a community, and thatâ€™s how Iâ€™d like to keep it. I cherish the real friendships that have been built from this little following!

4. I engage with accounts outside my niche. Yep, my algorithm is filled with Taylor Swift, good eats and coffee shops, golden retrievers, amazing illustrators and painters, politics and videographers. Not just board games ğŸ˜‡ 

5. I donâ€™t show my face. Despite being repeatedly told that it will boost my follower count, I just donâ€™t want to be that type of content creator...and thatâ€™s perfectly okay! When my face is in front of a camera it will be for a board game talk show. You heard it here first ğŸ˜
